pros: Good pays, flexible schedule and easy money

pros: fun job, you get to meet a lot of interesting people. the people you work with in your team are also great, and welcome new employees that may be shy initially.
cons: base salary could be increased, considering that commissions are taken out of your pacycheck if a donor of yours cancels within 4 months. in my opinion, if base salary is to remain at 16.25, then commissions should not be taken out of pay checks should donors cancel. it should be the fundraiser’s job to get donors (which we do), but the non-profit’s job to keep their donors through follow-ups and emails.

pros: They paid above minimum wage
cons:
- the job was to call out to anyone walking by to ask them to sign up to make a blood donation. People do not like being approached like this and it makes you feel like some sort of predator.
- management from another province constantly wrote messages to your team to tell you how bad you are at your job while choosing to position you at places with low amounts of foot traffic or places that made little sense for recruitment (e.g. off to the side at a rib-eating festival)

pros: There are no pros to working here.
cons:
-will only take credit card not cash for fundraising because they want peoples information and don’t actually care about the money being raised.
-if you don’t get enough people to sign up they will fire you. Most people only lasted a couple weeks because unsurprisingly most people don’t feel like giving out their credit card information to random people asking for it in the street.

pros: It provides an opportunity to explore more places and contribute for the betterment of the world

pros: Good culture, Team Spirit, Collaboration
cons: Not really any such negatives

review_title: A Company That Makes a Difference
pros:
Up Fundraising has a dynamic and supportive team atmosphere that is really making a difference in the charity sector.

The whole team is dedicated to doing what ever it takes to sign up quality donors for major non profits that we represent.

Up Fundraising wants all its staff to be successful, and is always there to speak with staff, encourage and motivate them, and provide extra training.
I've loved watching people who've never managed before, grow in confidence and move up with in the company and build their careers in the charity sector.

These are some of the friendliest and most diverse transition have ever worked on, and everyone works so hard but has a lot of fun while doing it.

The president is inspirational and inclusive to all, for example providing a flexible work schedule to myself as a woman, allowing me to work at the level I want to whilst balancing my family life.
cons:
Not cons, but important to note:
It is a target orientated job, and people need to enjoy targets and understand why we have them, and if we don't get them, we aren't helping the charities we represent. 

We work in teams, so we need to be positive and honest with ourselves about how we effect each other. Everyone should be responsible for their behavior and actions, which is something we all understand and why our teams work well and have high standards. It only takes one negative person to effect a team.

pros: Social & fun work culture
cons: The work is not easy

pros: It was a good experience
cons: Not bad at all experience

pros:
Travel Allowance
Flexible hours
Great opportunity for career advancement
cons: Insurance not available until you become a TL

pros: I've been working at Up Fundraising for over 3 years and it's been an incredible experience.  I started booking events and retail spaces as well as client management for our charity partners and quickly moved into a Director role in my 3rd year. Friendly work environment, down to earth colleagues, excellent benefits, generous bonuses and raises.  Everyone from trainers to team leaders to the CEO to account managers are very approachable and helpful.  If you work hard and have a positive attitude, the growth opportunities are endless at Up Fundraising, I'm very grateful for the professional growth I've developed here over the years.
cons: For field staff:  you interact with a lot of people and need to be okay with rejection. It may take a week or two to adjust. Must be driven, flexible, and willing to learn

review_title: WORST COMPANY I HAVE EVERY WORKED FOR!!!!
pros: Meeting great people but they all quit or got "fired"
cons:
-RACIST, RACIST, RACIST!! The President and the Managing Director are both racist and make it verbally known in the open concept office
(Anyone saying this is not true must be getting paid a very high salary in order to lie about something so serious )

-Managing Director told recruiters not hire people from Muslim decent which did lead to a Muslim employee herself ending up quitting.

-The President is known within the Marketing world as a hot head , it’s VERY true and he goes into sporadic screaming attacks within the office that scares employees.

-The Head Office feels like a Mickey Mouse Club, or a High School, they talk bad about each other, they make fun of one another, they gossip and they are the most unprofessional group of people I have ever encountered.. 

-Knewsales Group is basically the same thing, they have people working on both sides.

-The MOST racist and toxic company I have ever experienced in my life.

review_title: Great start to an upbeat career
pros:
I think that Up Fundraising was just created during my time when I was working in the company. This was my first Job after college and I do regret it! I will be honest, I thought I would just keep the job as a temporary thing, I ended up staying until I got a job in my industry which is information technology. They really teach you to get out of your shell and interact with people to reach your target.

They have multiple programs to be apart of depending your city.
cons: One of the things I did not like was the fact I needed to be in the office before going to the field, which is understandable now that I have gotten a bit older.

pros: I love working at Up! The team is really friendly, and there is a lot of opportunity to learn and grow. The managers are really approachable. I would definitely recommend it to a friend!
cons: There are no cons for me!

review_title: Growth Opportunities and Fun Work Culture
pros:
- fair base hourly rate, and solid bonus
- fun work and office culture - socials, parties, training from charities 
- lots of growth opportunities
cons:
- have to handle rejection 
- working outside in all weather
